content:
ServiceInstallerDialog Class

In this Article

Provides a dialog box, which prompts for account information of a Windows Service application.

Syntax

Declaration

public class ServiceInstallerDialog : System.Windows.Forms.Form

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • MarshalByRefObject
  • Component
  • Control
  • ScrollableControl
  • ContainerControl
  • System.Windows.Forms.Form
  • ServiceInstallerDialog

Remarks

Normally, you do not use the ServiceInstallerDialog class directly within your code; this dialog is generally used by the installation utility for a Windows Service application.

If a ServiceProcessInstaller object has the Account set to User, and either the Username or Password is an empty string (""), then the installation utility uses ServiceInstallerDialog to prompt for these values.

ServiceInstallerDialog derives from Form; use the Form class methods and properties to display and manipulate the dialog. For example, use ShowDialog to display the form, and then check the Result before validating the input text for the Username and Password properties.

Note

ServiceInstallerDialog does not check the credentials and privileges for the specified account. For example, the user might enter an invalid account name and password for the computer, or the account might not have the correct privileges to run as a service. Validate the user input to ensure that the installed service runs successfully.

Constructors summary

ServiceInstallerDialog()

Initializes a new instance of the service account form.

Properties summary

Password

Gets or sets the password for the service account form.
Result

Gets the dialog result for the service account form.
Username

Gets or sets the user name for the service account form.

Methods summary

Main()

Begins running a standard application message loop and displays the service account form.

Constructors

  • ServiceInstallerDialog()

    Initializes a new instance of the service account form.

    public ServiceInstallerDialog ();

    Remarks

    A new ServiceInstallerDialog form has its Result set to ServiceInstallerDialogResult, the Username set to an empty string (""), and the Password set to an empty string.

Properties

  • Password

    Gets or sets the password for the service account form.

    public string Password { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string representing the password in the service account form. The default is an empty string ("").

    Remarks

    The ServiceInstallerDialog does not validate the Username and Password values. The dialog checks that the user confirms the password, but it does not authenticate the account credentials on the computer.

  • Result

    Gets the dialog result for the service account form.

    public System.ServiceProcess.Design.ServiceInstallerDialogResult Result { get; }

    Property Value

    • ServiceInstallerDialogResult

      A ServiceInstallerDialogResult indicating the user response to the dialog box. The default is OK.

    Remarks

    Use ShowDialog to prompt the user for the service installation account, then check the Result value. If the value is ServiceInstallerDialogResult, verify that the input Username and Password are valid.

  • Username

    Gets or sets the user name for the service account form.

    public string Username { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string representing the user name in the service account form. The default is an empty string ("").

    Remarks

    The ServiceInstallerDialog does not validate the Username or Password values.

Methods

  • Main()

    Begins running a standard application message loop and displays the service account form.

    public static void Main ();

    Remarks

    This method is equivalent to calling Run on a new ServiceInstallerDialog form; it is typically used for testing purposes.

    Call ShowDialog on the ServiceInstallerDialog form to display the dialog box in your application.
